title: Senior Software Engineer (Full Stack)
description:
Thanks for your interest in working with us! Defendify is a fast-growing, fun-loving cybersecurity startup with a small, vibrant team based in Portland, Maine. Resourcefulness, responsiveness, problem-solving, and simplicity are values that shape who we are, what we do, and how we deliver amazing customer experiences.

Position Details

We're looking for a senior full stack software engineer to join us full-time, locally and/or in a remote capacity. This is a unique and exciting opportunity as we continue to expand the footprint of our groundbreaking, all-in-one cybersecurity platform. Every team member is a valuable contributor to our core SaaS product with day-to-day responsibilities covering a variety of development needs including building, maintaining, QA, and support for every aspect of the Defendify platform.

We are looking for a team player who:

  • Has a passion for solving problems and is eager to grow, learn, and tackle daily and long-term challenges and goals.
  • Will dig in and ask questions from users to understand requirements; make a plan; dive into an existing codebase and learn where to make changes, or where to start new code.
  • Is a good communicator who enjoys collaboration and thrives in a development culture that values clean code, automation and testability.
  • Maintains excellent knowledge of how modern web applications work, including REST API usage, application security, cloud deployment and development best practices.
  • Is comfortable self-directing their own work. No micro-management here!

Requirements – Experience

  • 5+ years of Full-Stack Development experience
  • Has been responsible for the entire lifecycle of code in at least one project, from scratch to QA to deployment to maintenance.
  • Has experience implementing a RESTful API and an application which consumes it.
  • Is familiar with the philosophy and implementation of development automation: tests, continuous integration, cloud deployment, and frequent production releases using an Agile/SCRUM process.
  • Some DevOps experience is required.

Requirements – Technical

  • Experienced in JavaScript including ES6, await/async, linting and front-end frameworks. We use libraries and frameworks as needed, but you need to be able to write and understand plain JS.
  • Experience with Node and Browser based environments is required.
  • Understands REST APIs and their role in application architectures. Has used and built APIs from the ground up.
  • Experience with front end development: HTML, CSS, and familiarity with the ecosystem of related technologies (SASS, DOM). In addition, Vue (or similar framework) experience and knowledge of static site generators such as Jekyll/Hugo are helpful.
  • Understand how to use Git(+Hub) and GitHub Flow.
  • Some relational database experience is required. Pluses include: Experiences in relational and in-memory databases (MySQL, Postgres, Redis) as well as knowledge in generic SQL.
  • Some experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), Heroku, or similar services.

Your Success

You are not alone in your role – Defendify's engineering team is made up of "A" players dedicated to your training and success. We thrive on an open-door policy and transparent management system that fosters team collaboration.

Compensation and Benefits

This is a flexible position open to candidates with varying levels of experience and offers long term growth potential via a well-defined career path. Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience, and is variable based on personal and team performance. Our benefits package is comprehensive and includes health, dental, and vision coverage, educational reimbursement, a 401(k) program, paid time-off and more.

Love What You Do

Defendify employees enjoy a modern work environment and culture where everyone genuinely cares about the work they do. We're passionate about our product, the problems we're solving, our customers, our partners, and our team. We're in it together, enjoying work and play every day from team lunches, impromptu social outings and celebrations, and charity missions. And yes, there is coffee, lots and lots of coffee!

Opportunity Knocks

This position offers a great opportunity to make an impact as a part of a small team solving big problems, making cybersecurity possible for Small Business. Are you a creative self-starter with an appetite to learn and grow? If so, we'd love to hear from you!

title: Full Stack Developer: PHP/Python
description:
Full Stack Developer: PHP/Python

Parklink Limited seeks a skilled, motivated candidate to fill the position of remote Full-Stack Developer fluent in Python and PHP, who loves the challenges of high-availabilty SaaS and working with hardware. To maintain team coherence, we are looking specifically in Europe: GMT+0 - GMT+3.

Company Introduction

Parklink Development Limited provides RFID duplication devices to locksmiths and security professionals.

Our flagship product is 'Rebadge'. It's a patented machine that duplicates RFID badges for customers. Before Rebadge, it was impossible to duplicate consumer RFID badges. Since the launch of Rebadge, literally hundreds of thousands of people have been able to make copies of their badges, and the number increases every day.

Each machine is an embedded linux system running Python + Qt, and tethered online. Supporting the machines is a RESTful API (CakePHP). There is also a full back-office system for client management, machine management, billing, etc.

We've got over 2,000 machines online (Check out our coverage map here: https://rebadge.eu )

We've recently expanded into Australian market, and are rolling out mobile tools. With this growth comes new challenges, and this is where your expertise comes in.

The team currently consists of five staff: the founder, operating as COO, our CTO as Dev Lead, an Electronic Engineer, Administrative staff and a Technical Support role. The successful candidate would be the sixth member on the team. The company structure is based in Hong Kong, but the team is spread around the world and fully remote.

We are a highly optimised / lean company. The successful candidate will have the ability to work autonomously on a constantly evolving product and rapidly expanding client base. You will work on a real product that is used by thousands of people daily.

Working for us means you'll be able to flex your development muscles, and you'll have a real impact on a real product that exists in the real-world, used by thousands of people every day. It's an exciting possibility.

We are not another boring SaaS company. We create, manufacture and deploy real hardware on a global scale, with back and front end code managing it all. You'll have a chance to get your hands onto hardware, software, development and deployment. If you're driven, curious, and a hacker at heart, this position is for you.

We will provide you with all the training and tools you need, an annual travel budget, and a dynamic, fair and respectful work environment.

Reciprocatively, we are seeking to work with someone that is honest, skilled, self-motivated, and reliable.

Tasks

As a Full Stack Developer, your tasks will be divided into two categories:

  • Backend Development (CakePHP)
  • Embedded Development (Python)

Backend Development

Our systems (API + Back-office) are based on the CakePHP framework, backed by a geographically Distributed High-Availability LAMP stack (Europe + Asia)

The RESTful API provides the interface to the network of machines, and the back office provides administration functionality for us and our clients. Backend Development Tasks

  • Maintaining & Developing the API [PHP / CakePHP]
  • Maintaining & Developing the Administration Interface [PHP / CakePHP]
  • Maintaining & Optimisation of the Database [MySQL]

We have short, medium and long term goals, and milestones setup for our system. You're coming into a stable, clean, code base that we'll give you all necessary training on.

Our frameworks are under GitHub source control, with a CI environment for staging and production.

We will provide necessary development environments (VirtualBox environment).

Embedded Development

We have 2000+ networked machines deployed. Each machine is powered by a Raspberry Pi 3, with dual-frequency RFID readers and touch screen. We have a custom linux deployment running the client software, written in Python + Qt [Pyside]

The software is under clean, stable, and under active development. Embedded Development Tasks

  • Maintaining & Developing machine software [Python]
  • Maintaining a Unit Testing framework [Python / FrogLogic Squish]
  • Development / Maintenance of System scripts / environment [Linux / Bash]

We will provide all necessary training + hardware required to get started on the systems.

Skill / Experience Requirements

Technical Skills

Python 3 [Fluent]

  • QT / PySide Experience Bonus
  • Ability to write, respect & maintain unit tests

PHP 5/7 [Fluent]

  • OOP (PSR-1 & 2) Obligatory
  • CakePHP Experience Bonus
  • Ability to write, respect & maintain unit tests (CodeCeption, PHPUnit)

Git/GitHub competency

  • Fluent with Git, respecting & maintaining development procedures (issue branch, code review, pull request, merge, etc)

Database (Mysql)

  • Query optimisation for high load environments

High Traffic, High Availability Clusters

  • Experience with distributed server clusters and writing highly optimised code for high-load environments - understanding the requirements of high-load environments

Linux Familiarity

  • Intermediate configuration & administration tasks (SSH, Bash, etc)
  • Rasbian Experience Bonus
Bonus Skills

Mobile Development

  • Native iPhone Development
  • Native Android Development

Hardware Familiarity

  • Raspberry PI
  • Serial / UART

NFC Familiarity [Bonus]

  • 13.56 (Mifare, libNFC, etc)
  • 125KHz (T55, EM4XX etc)

Personal Skills

  • English (Fluency in written + spoken)
  • Ability to communicate clearly and efficiently
  • Ability to work autonomously & self-motivate
  • Ability to integrate into an existing team & structure

Time Requirements

Physically based in Europe / GMT+0 - GMT+3 This is a full time, remote position (8 hours per day, 5 days per week) Reachable during work hours via phone / slack

Compensation

  • 40 - 45k EURO per year (depending on experience and skills coverage)
  • 2k EURO Hardware Allowance
  • Annual Travel Allowance
  • We will provide all training required
  • We will provide all hardware necessary (Devices, parts, badges, etc)
  • Flexible time off: 25 Paid Vacation days + 11 Paid Public Holidays

Application Pre-requisites

  • Your updated CV
  • A brief email explaining who you are, why you fit the position, and how your experience is relevant.
  • A link to your GitHub/GitLab account - if applicable
  • An overview of your side projects that you work on / contribute to.

Applying

Please send an email with all requisite documents to jobs@parklink.asia.

We will take time to study each application with diligence - please take the time to read over the position requirements carefully.
how_to_apply: Please send an email with all requisite documents to jobs@parklink.asia.

title: Senior Backend Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
The world is transitioning towards renewable energy generation and sustainable transportation to counteract global climate change. Batteries are both the key and the achilles heel of this transition. Our mission is to enable efficient development and long lifetime of stationary energy storage systems and electric vehicles with our Predictive Battery Analytic Software based on Digital Twins. Join us on our way to an emission free future. We are a fast growing venture capital financed start-up of 50 employees - become part of the family!

Your daily business will involve

  • Actively driving and implementing technical concepts for the feature set of our SaaS battery analytics platform for ingesting battery field data, calculating & predicting battery conditions and presenting it at large scale
  • Breaking down difficult challenges and successfully delivering customer value on schedule
  • Participate in the entire application lifecycle, focusing on designing, coding, testing, documentation, deployment, debugging, and optimizing the application for maximum speed and scalability - You build it, you run it!
  • Closely collaborating in a cross-functional team of Frontend, DevOps, Cloud Engineers, Battery/Machine Learning Engineers, Product Manager & UX Designer to jointly develop & deliver the best possible products to our customers
  • Providing servant leadership to the software team from being a sparring partner on topics, as well as providing mentorship including industry standard code reviews for personal development of the Software Engineers

Your profile

  • Degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • 5+ years of experience of backend software engineering in the field of building applications and microservices in Python (any additional high-level programming language is a plus)
  • 3+ years of leadership experience in cross-functional teams
  • Solid programming background and ability to write clean, structured and tested code
  • Proven track of records in designing/architecting and scaling high load data platforms (you know where and why to put a message queue, which database to choose, where to put borders between microservices)
  • Support and guide the team to ensure all committed stories for the sprint are completed per the sprint goal, while also actively participating in coding, you are not only a “ticket writer + work assignment manager”, but an Agile Team Member
  • You are a strong self-driven leader, you aren’t afraid talking to stakeholders and teammates, come up with balanced and reasonable proposals together with the Team and continuously improve development processes & mentoring of your colleagues.
  • Fluent in English
  • Interest in new Technologies & building a great Saas Platform

Additional Skills that are nice to have

  • TypeScript
  • Cloud experience, preferably AWS
  • Having concretely worked in the area of SaaS / Analytics / Data Platforms
  • Finding your way around the “terminal”

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible working hours and Homeoffice
  • Strong team culture with regular team events and off-sites
  • Modern office in Munich with free parking spaces
  • Free breakfast, snacks and coffee; subsidized lunch in a high quality canteen (vegetarian options available)
  • Support with visa application

title: Developers / Make an impact to people's lives!
description:
It is an exciting time for you to join us at One Digital. We are changing Nordea with big ambitions and creating the future of digital banking – and we would like you to be a part of it!

About us

At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we are deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We are creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together and we are always looking for new talents to join us with their unique set of skills, ideas and backgrounds. With us, you will be in good company with a chance to challenge how we see the banking industry today and impact the future direction of digital banking.

Our offer to you

Welcome to One Digital, the biggest banking platform in the Nordics! You will be joining an awesome group of people from across the world that delivers innovative solutions to our customers, ensuring that Nordea will stay as the frontrunner in digital banking services. One Digital is responsible for the majority of mass-distributed front-end and API related development for Nordea’s customers. The deliveries cover areas such as mobile banking, netbanks, our platform for digital sales, digital design and digital customer experience.

Working with us, you will take part in building a better digital bank and thus play a meaningful role in our society. We are impacting the lives of our 11 million customers around the world by helping them fulfil their daily banking needs. You will have the possibility to influence how people do digital banking and change Nordea to meet the future. We are looking for people that are passionate about developing great software solutions for our digital platform. We are a product and technology focused engineering capability area, covering all engineering roles in agile teams: developers together with team QA persons.

Workplaces: Finland: Helsinki, Oulu

In 2021, providing customers with great digital experiences is more important than ever. This is an exciting time for you to join us and shape the future of digital banking. If you are looking for a new challenge, and believe you have what it takes to help us achieve our vision, then One Digital could be the place for you!

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Senior Software Engineer

Who We Are:

Over 10,000 people are turning 65 each day, eighty percent of whom desire to age in place at their home with dignity and independence, resulting in over $100 billion spent annually on at-home care. Homethrive is looking to disrupt the traditional care model and provide enhanced holistic solutions to our aging population.

Homethrive provides technology, care management, and personal assistance services to help aging loved ones thrive at home with dignity and purpose while reducing the stress and workload on family members who support them. Homethrive matches each client and their family with one of its Master’s level social workers (Care Guides) who develops an ongoing trusted relationship with the family. Homethrive’s Care Guide provides expert coaching to help seniors embrace healthy behaviors and help family members anticipate and better handle the challenges of supporting and aging loved one. Homethrive’s Care Guide also recommends and coordinates any necessary third-party services to provide meals, transportation, home care, medication delivery or other services.

Job Description Summary:

We have a proven successful model, are experiencing tremendous growth and are now looking at ways to streamline and scale. This is where technology and you come in. In the near-term we want to enhance the relationships built with our clients by augmenting the human intelligence of our Care Guides with artificial intelligence and self-service solutions, and find ways to use technology and data to extend reach, improve efficiency, and efficacy of our solutions and services.

Homethrive is a very well-funded startup, offering competitive pay and full benefits with a small versatile technology team. We are looking to at least double the team size this year and quadruple it by 2021. As a team we develop and own all of our software/technology and data in-house, only relying on 3rd party integrations/services where it makes sense.

Technology we use today: Golang on the back-end. React.js on the front-end. MySQL, MongoDB and Elastic search databases. Flutter for cross platform native app development. Cloud hosting on AWS using a mixture of Docker on Elastic-beanstalk and serverless architecture along with other services like S3, RDS, Lex, etc. All technology decisions are made together as a team always utilizing the best technological solutions available for the task at hand (we will be expanding to Rust/WASM development soon). We promote an Agile development environment with test driven development and continuous integration, leveraging communication over documentation and where the only measurement of progress is working software.

We are looking for more tech savvy, innovative, full stack polyglots who love problem solving and just making things work better. Software engineers with the foundational skills and the desire/ability to learn the latest tech should apply. This position can be partial/full remote.

Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's and/or Masters in Computer Science OR related field of study. 5+ years of experience in post-graduate software development (full-time, NON-internship). Advanced proficiency in at least one (any) language. Proficiency in at least one (any) database technology. Desire and ability to learn the tech we use and the new tech we will be using in the future.

Homethrive provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including sex stereotyping), national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), physical disability, mental disability, age, military status or status as a Vietnam-era or special disabled veteran, marital status, registered domestic partner status, gender, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition (including, but not limited to, cancer related or HIV/AIDS related), genetic information, sexual orientation or any other status protected by applicable federal, state and local laws

title: Full-Stack-Entwickler (m/w/d) C++ / C# / JavaScript / WebAssembly
description:
Als Full-Stack-Entwickler (m/w/d) C++ / C# / JavaScript / WebAssembly gestalten Sie heute schon mit, was die Zukunft bringt!

Als Pionier im Digital Health schlägt unser Herz für die Entwicklung und Umsetzung neuer Technologien. Für die nächste Stufe der e-Health Evolution suchen wir kreative Köpfe, die Spaß an der Arbeit mit vielfältigen Technologien, eigenen Gestaltungsspielräumen und der beruflichen Weiterentwicklung haben.

Ihr Beitrag:

  • Sie designen, entwickeln und implementieren neue Software-Komponenten für unsere Krankenkassensysteme
  • Dabei leisten Sie einen wichtigen Beitrag bei der Backend- bzw. Frontend-Entwicklung unserer Softwarelösungen
  • Hier arbeiten Sie mit Technologien wie C++, C#, JavaScript, JAVA, WebAssembly und Blazor
  • Darüber hinaus behandeln und lösen Sie Programmfehler im Rahmen des 3rd-Level-Support

Was uns wichtig ist:

  • Abgeschlossene Ausbildung, z. B. als Fachinformatiker (m/w/d) oder Studium im Bereich IT, z. B. in Informatik, Software Engineering oder Computer Sciences
  • Erste Berufserfahrungen in der Anwendungsentwicklung mit C++, C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, Java, HTML, CSS und PHP sind wünschenswert
  • Interesse daran, sich mit neuen Technologien (KI/ML) und Bereichen der Softwareentwicklung auseinanderzusetzen
  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Was Sie von uns erwarten können:

  • Die Möglichkeit, beim Marktführer der Branche zu arbeiten
  • Wir legen großen Wert auf ein kollegiales und von Gemeinschaftsgefühl geprägtes Umfeld
  • Freiraum für Ihre Ideen innerhalb eines agilen und hochspezialisierten Umfeldes
  • Flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege innerhalb der Abteilungen
  • Nationale und internationalen Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten sowie zahlreiche Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen und Schulungen (u.a. in-house-training in Englisch)
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten, die eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance ermöglichen
  • Zuschuss zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge als Baustein einer sicheren Zukunft
  • Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement (Obst- & Gemüsekorb, Getränke, Untersuchungen)

Sie erleichtern es uns schnell richtige Entscheidungen zu treffen, wenn Sie uns über das Bewerbungsformular Ihre aussagekräftigen Unterlagen mit Ihren Gehaltsvorstellungen übermitteln.

title: Backend-Webentwickler (m/w/d)
description:
Als Webentwickler*in im Agenturumfeld hast du es echt gut. Denn hier erwarten dich wirklich abwechslungsreiche Projekte und Herausforderungen. Starre und veraltete Prozesse suchst du bei uns vergebens. Nahezu alles was du brauchst um sauber entwickeln zu können, stellen wir dir zur Verfügung. Für einen fachlichen Austausch auf Augenhöhe und gemeinsame Projekte, stehen dir die besten Kollegen jederzeit und hilfsbereit zur Seite. Aber, was soll das ganze Gesülze? Komm vorbei, lerne uns kennen! Mach dir selbst ein Bild und tausche dich mit unserem Team aus. Ganz unverbindlich.

🖖 Deine Aufgaben

  • Technische Konzeption und Umsetzung von interaktiven Projekten (Okay, das kam jetzt sicherlich überraschend...)
  • Neu- und Weiterentwicklung von Web-Applikationen auf der Basis von PHP (Auch Java Entwickler können PHP lieben lernen... Wirklich!)
  • Realisierung von Schnittstellen, Erweiterung oder Entwicklung von Modulen (Mit oder ohne Stack Overflow...)
  • Wartung und Dokumentation (Schnarch, aber gehört halt dazu...)
  • Fachlische und seelische Betreuung unserer Frontendler (...)

🤘 Dein Profil

  • Du hast im Bereich IT was drauf (...und vielleicht sogar eine Ausbildung oder Studium in dem Bereich in der Tasche!?)
  • Mind. 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung (Oder noch besser Berufserfahrung, seit du 3 Jahre alt bist...)
  • Ausgeprägtes Interesse für Web-Technologien (Sonst würdest du dir diese Anzeige wohl nicht durchlesen...)
  • Ein Gespür für aufkommende Trends und Themen (Wir haben gehört, PHP5 ist out...)
  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der objektorientierten Softwareentwicklung mit PHP (Du weißt, PHP steht nicht für PornHub Premium!)
  • Erfahrung im Umgang mit Datenbanken, speziell MySQL (A SQL query walks into a bar and sees two tables. He walks up to them and says 'Can I join you?')
  • REST, GraphQL und SOAP sollten wir was sagen (Wir müssen endlich herausfinden, ob unsere Kaffeemaschine eine API hat...)
  • Erfahrung mit Versionierung auf Basis von Git (Und kennst 'git blame', um zu gucken, wer es kaputt gemacht hat...)
  • Folgende Kenntnisse sind wünschenswert, allerdings keine Voraussetzung: Contao, Symfony, Shopware (Ist doch eh alles das Gleiche...)
  • Spaß am Entwickeln, Mut zu eigenen Ideen und deren Umsetzung und natürlich Lust am Arbeiten im Team (Einige von uns beißen nicht!)
  • Was? Du kannst noch mehr? Ey, ist nicht schlimm!

⭐ Dich erwartet als Entwickler*in

  • Eine gemeinsam erarbeitete Onboarding-Strategie
  • Mitbestimmung in der Optimierung unserer Prozesse und Workflows
  • Spannende und abwechslungsreiche Projekte mit Anspruch
  • Aktuellste Hard- und Software und Entwicklungsumgebungen
  • Regelmäßige Teilnahme an Events, Messen und Entwicklerkonferenzen (...und den Messepartys danach!)

👌 Dich erwartet als MAWler*in

  • Ein leidenschaftliches Experten-Team und eine familiäre Atmosphäre
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und mobile Arbeitsplätze
  • Freiräume für Forschung und Entwicklung
  • Attraktive Incentives
  • Freitags Essen von unserem Koch Enzo (Das reicht eigentlich schon als Argument..)

title: Young Talent Programma
description:
Young Talent Programma

Wat doe je als Young Talent bij IVO Rechtspraak? Het antwoord op die vraag is een inkoppertje. Want ons Young Talent Programma draait maar om één ding: dat jij je talenten als ICT-professional maximaal ontwikkelt en inzet! We halen alles uit de kast, met een programma op maat van jou! In twee jaar tijd krijg je volop de kans om kennis en ervaring op te doen en je soft skills te vergroten. Je leert daarbij de nieuwste methodes en tools kennen, want bij IVO Rechtspraak lopen we daarin voorop. We werken bijvoorbeeld agile, in scrumteams en op basis van BusDevOps. Bovendien heb je óók nog eens maatschappelijke impact. Jij helpt de digitale rechtspraak toegankelijk te maken voor iedereen!

Verschillende richtingen We zoeken Young Talents in verschillende richtingen:

  • Informatie Analist
  • Angular Developer
  • Software Developer Java
  • Software Developer .NET
  • Software Tester
  • DevOps Engineer
  • IT Trainer

Je draagt heel concreet bij aan de digitalisering en het digitaal toegankelijk maken van de rechtspraak. Met toepassingen voor medewerkers van de rechtspraak, zoals rechters en de mensen van de Griffies. Voor ketenpartners, zoals het OM, advocaten, de politie of de kinderbescherming. Maar ook voor ‘de man of vrouw in de straat’ die met de rechtspraak te maken krijgt.

Je werkt agile, in SCRUM-teams en op basis van BusDevOps. Lekker dynamisch en dicht bij de gebruiker. Ook pas je de nieuwste technologieën toe. Waar de markt stopt, ontwikkelen wij vaak zelf nog door. Je kunt je creativiteit dus goed kwijt!

Benieuwd naar de ervaringen van Young Talent Niek Visser? Je leest het in zijn blog.

Hoe je programma eruitziet Samen kijken we welke richting jij het beste uitgaat en hoe we je het snelste ‘op vlieghoogte’ brengen. Dat is altijd een combinatie van werkervaring opdoen en leren, zo breng je nieuwe kennis direct in de praktijk. Je werkt in een team en hebt daarin je eigen inbreng. Daarnaast krijg je vakinhoudelijke trainingen, daar maken we duidelijke afspraken over. Binnen je team heb je een buddy die je begeleidt en zelfs een coach behoort tot de mogelijkheden.

Aan je soft skills werk je samen met de andere deelnemers aan ons Young Talent Programma. In workshops leer je bijvoorbeeld met feedback omgaat en hoe je initiatief neemt. Het leuke van dit gezamenlijke onderdeel is dat je meteen de andere talenten uit jouw lichting leert kennen. Al zitten ze in een heel ander team. Handig om ervaringen uit te wisselen en gewoon gezellig!

Ben jij een ambitieuze starter of beginnend professional? En wil je al je kwaliteiten benutten in een baan met inhoud én mooie carrièrevooruitzichten in de ICT? Grijp dan nu je kans en doe mee aan het Young Talent Programma van IVO Rechtspraak!

Wat we je bieden Om te beginnen een leuke, informele werksfeer. We houden de lijnen graag kort! En je arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn prima geregeld volgens de CAO Rijk. Wat belangrijke punten op een rij:

  • Je salaris is €2.824 op basis van 36-urige werkweek. Je zit in schaal 9.
  • Je krijgt een Individueel Keuze Budget (IKB) van 16,37% over je salaris. Dit is inclusief je vakantiegeld en eindejaarsuitkering. Je kunt dit budget bijvoorbeeld laten uitkeren of in vrije dagen omzetten. Ook is het mogelijk vrije dagen te sparen.
  • Je houdt werk en privé prima in balans, bijvoorbeeld met de mogelijkheid van 4×9 uur, thuis werken of ouderschapsverlof. Bovendien krijg je 144 vakantie- en 21,6 IKB-uren op basis van een 36-urige werkweek.
  • Je hebt veel doorgroeimogelijkheden. Zeker omdat we alles doen op IT-gebied, van architectuur tot ontwikkeling en beheer. Ook is er alle ruimte om je vakkennis en persoonlijke skills te ontwikkelen.
  • Bij IVO Rechtspraak stimuleren we reizen met het OV! Je krijgt een OV-chipkaart waarmee je gratis naar je werk reist.

We verwachten in april 2021 te starten met het programma.

Wat we van je vragen Dit zijn de dingen waar je volgens het ideaalplaatje aan voldoet:

  • Je hebt een hbo- of wo-studie afgerond met een sterke ICT-component
  • Je hebt niet meer dan 2 jaar werkervaring
  • Je hebt ervaring met programmeren
  • Je wilt veel leren en jezelf ontwikkelen
  • Je bent initiatiefrijk
  • Je houdt wel van een uitdaging
  • Je Nederlands is uitstekend, zowel spreken als schrijven

Doe je mee aan ons talentprogramma, dan vragen we ook altijd een Verklaring Omtrent Gedrag.

Meer weten? Benieuwd naar ervaringen van onze Young Talents of naar specifieke vacatures binnen het programma?

Kijk dan op: www.werkenbijderechtspraak.nl/ivo-rechtspraak/young-talent-programma-ivo-rechtspraak/

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Trefwoorden: Software Engineer, DevOps Engineer, IT Trainer, Angular Developer, Platform Engineer, Software Tester, IT, ICT
how_to_apply:
Is het Young Talent Programma bij IVO Rechtspraak iets voor jou? Kijk dan nu snel op onze Young talent pagina voor alle Young talent vacatures en reageer dan uiterlijk 28 februari via onze sollicitatiepagina.

Meer weten? Bel Peter Versteeg, 06 3168 4603, HR adviseur.

title: Senior C++ Softwareentwickler (m/w/d) (ganz oder teilweise im Homeoffice möglich)
description:
Unsere Kunden schätzen die Teamarbeit, Professionalität und Qualität unserer Ergebnisse. Dieser Erfolg basiert auf der Summe aus Enthusiasmus, Liebe zur IT, Innovation und der Wertschätzung jedes einzelnen Kollegen.

Werde Teil unseres knapp 60 Kopf starken Teams in Jena. Im JenTower findest Du Deinen Platz über den Dächern und im Zentrum Jenas.

Deine Aufgaben bei uns

  • C++ Softwareentwicklung in verschiedenen Hochtechnologie Projekten
  • Teilweise Hardwarenahe Entwicklung sowie Testausführung direkt an den Geräten
  • Technische Führung von Entwicklungsprojekten
  • Sicherung von Quellcode-Qualitätsstandards
  • Konzeption, Programmierung und Weiterentwicklung komplexer Applikationen und Architekturen
  • Direkte Zusammenarbeit eng mit dem Kunden beginnend bei Anforderungsanalyse bis hin zu Dokumentation und Deployment
  • Mittel bis Langfristig (ca. 1-3 Jahre) wechselnde Projekte und Herausforderungen
  • Projekt übergreifender Erfahrungs- und Wissensaustausch

Was wir von Dir erwarten

  • Sehr umfassende Kenntnisse in c++ und modernen Standards, mindestens ab c++11
  • 5+ Jahre Programmiererfahrung
  • Moderne Softwareentwicklung (Workflows, Versionskontrollsysteme, Ticketsysteme, Buildsysteme und Automatisierung, Testautomatisierung)
  • Plattformübergreifende Erfahrung sowohl bei Systemumgebungen, Compilern und Bibliotheken
  • Du kennst dich mit den verschiedenen OpenSource Lizenzen aus
  • Mentoring anderer Kollegen
  • Embedded - Knowhow wäre großartig
  • Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Qt ist von Vorteil
  • Du weißt, wie du deinen Code richtig testest
  • Flexibilität und Enthusiasmus für verschiedene Technologien
  • Erfahrung aus dem regulierten Umfeld ( Medizintechnik , Automotive , Luft- und Raumfahrt ) wünschenswert

Wir bieten Dir

  • Spannende Projekte mit viel Abwechslung
  • Leistungsgerechte Bezahlung
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Arbeitsort Deiner Wahl
  • Aktive Förderung von Weiterbildung mit festem Budget
  • Gesundheitsförderung und regelmäßiges Bewegungsprogramm
  • Mitarbeiter-Events
  • Job-Ticket für den öffentlichen Nahverkehr
  • Obst-Flatrate

Du willst erst einmal sehen, wie das bei uns so läuft?

Super! Genauso geht’s uns mit Dir. Schick uns einfach ein paar Deiner aussagekräftigsten Arbeiten. Auch Unfertiges kann viel von Deinem eigentlichen Können erzählen, also trau Dich! Wir freuen uns über ein Anschreiben, das uns erzählt, wer Du bist, was Du machst und wo Du hin willst. Haben wir uns erst einmal kennengelernt, entscheiden wir gemeinsam, wie es mit uns weitergeht.

title: DevOps Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
Wir bei EITCO entwickeln IT-Lösungen, die Arbeitsabläufe und Geschäftsprozesse intelligent und wirksam verbessern.

Die Zufriedenheit unserer Kunden und Partner steht bei EITCO ebenso im Mittelpunkt wie das Wohlbefinden unserer Mitarbeiter.

Als mittelständisches Dienstleistungsunternehmen sind wir stolz auf unsere flache Hierarchie, die flexiblen Arbeitsbedingungen sowie unsere wertschätzende und familiäre Atmosphäre.

Dies ist die Basis unserer Leistungsfähigkeit, mit der wir seit vielen Jahren erfolgreich am Markt sind.

https://www.eitco.de

Wir suchen

Für unser Application Management Team suchen wir ab sofort einen DevOps Engineer (m/w/d) für Systemintegration zur Festanstellung in Vollzeit, der die Schnittstelle zwischen Systemtechnik, Anwendungsentwicklung und Fachabteilung bildet.

Deine Position

  • Betreuung der Anwendung im Betrieb
  • Verantwortung für den Applikationsbetrieb, u.a. Überwachung Installationen und Fortführung
  • Anpassung des Servicedesigns des Verfahrens, z.B. bei Änderung der Parameter sowie Anpassungen der Architektur
  • Verantwortung für den Betrieb der Anwendung
  • Steuerung des Rollouts von Releases
  • Bewertung von Changes, z.B. die technische Umsetzung von fachlichen Änderungen bei der Entwicklung und deren Auswirkung auf den Applikationsbetrieb

Unsere Technologien

  • Linux (SLES, CentOS, Ubuntu)
  • Automatisierung / Konfigurationsmanagement (Puppet)
  • Versionsverwaltung (git)
  • Skriptsprachen (bash, ruby, powershell)
  • Java-Applicationserver (Tomcat)
  • Message Broker (Apache ActiveMQ)
  • RDBMS (PostgreSQL, MariaDB/MySQL, MS SQL)
  • Monitoring (Nagios, Prometheus)
  • ESB (Apache Karaf / Camel)
  • Virtualisierung (Virtualbox / vagrant, VmWare)

Dein Profil

  • Du bist vertraut mit Open Source Projekten und der Linux-Welt
  • Ein sicherer Umgang mit Apache Tomcat und diverser Middleware ist für dich kein Problem
  • ideal: Betreuung verteilter Systeme
  • ideal: Du hast Puppet-Kenntnisse
  • Teamgeist und Kommunikationsbereitschaft ist für dich selbstverständlich
  • Mindestens 1-2 Jahre Berufserfahrung oder Berufs-/ Quereinstieg
  • Deutsch auf muttersprachlichem Niveau und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Warum wir?

  • (Familien-) Freundliche Arbeitsatmosphäre
  • Flache Hierachien und kurze Entscheidungswege
  • Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
  • Community of Practice
  • Monatlicher OpenFriday mit Beiträgen aller Mitarbeitenden
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit Gleitzeit
  • 30 Tage Urlaub
  • Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement mit Betriebssport, Fitnessstudios und Leasingfahrrädern
  • Mitarbeiterbenefits
  • Einarbeitung mit eigenem Paten

Kontakt

Deine Ansprechpartnerin:

Meike Bodemann, HR Manager/Management Assistent European IT Consultancy EITCO GmbH Fon +49 (228) 338 881 150

Standorte: Berlin, Potsdamer Platz 10, 10785 Berlin Bonn, Am Bonner Bogen 6, 53227 Bonn

title: Microsoft Software Engineer. Dublin, Ireland.
description:
About This Role:

Microsoft engineers inspire, empower and lead. As an engineer at Microsoft Ireland, you can develop solutions used by hundreds of millions of people around the world. With teams working on Microsoft 365, Azure, Modern Workplace Transformation Solutions, Identity and Natural Language Experiences, there is no limit to what you can achieve

We are recruiting Software Engineers for teams across the organisation. Successful candidates must have an inquisitive, can-do mindset.The ability to break barriers, challenge the status quo, and build connections across organizations is crucial.

If you want to build best-in-class solutions using robust coding practices and the latest tech in a fast-paced DevOps environment, apply today.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and deliver the next generation of highly scalable, intelligent cloud services and products.
  • Build and support modern web applications and large-scale distributed services.
  • Produce high quality code that is unit tested, code reviewed, and checked regularly for continuous integration.
  • Collaborate with colleagues including product owners, UX designers, ML Engineers/Researchers, data scientists and other engineers to create delightful and meaningful experiences for our customers.
  • Evangelize and/or propose new ideas while "bringing others along”.
  • Demonstrate a sense of pride, ownership, and personal accountability for end-to-end products.
  • Learn continuously and work comfortably with the latest technologies (serverless, containerized apps, AI/ML, IoT, .NET Core, etc.) in Microsoft. 

Job Requirements:

Basic Requirements:

  • At least 5 years of experience as a software engineer or as a software developer
  • 3 years' minimum software development experience using OOP languages (C#, C++, Java, etc.)
  • 2 years' minimum experience working with cloud computing platforms like Azure, AWS, or similar
  • Experience with distributed systems design and implementation, especially microservices architecture
  • Software engineering fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, async programming patterns, object-oriented design, parallel programming).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with TypeScript or JavaScript or React or Angular;
  • A minimum of a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field, or equivalent alternative education, skills, and/or practical experience is required.
  • Machine Learning or Deep Learning experience would be a bonus but not required. After all, we believe in learning and growing on the job.

About you

Are you customer obsessed? Do you think about your customer’s needs and the scenarios they will arise in? Do you demonstrate user empathy and seek to create solutions that delight your customers?

Are you passionate about learning and applying the latest technologies while building high-quality web applications, APIs and microservices with high availability and reliability?

If this all sounds like you, you’re exactly the kind of candidate we’re looking for. Apply today.

About Microsoft Engineering

At Microsoft Engineer you can have impact at scale. we embrace the Growth Mindset to deliver impactful solutions for our customers. Collaboration, innovation and customer obsession are central to our culture. This environment inspires better solutions for our customers, partners and ultimately the world.

Benefits

  • Industry leading healthcare
  • Savings and investments
  • Generous annual leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Opportunities to network and connect
  • Discounts on products and services
  • Giving programs
  • Educational resources

Benefits/perks listed may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Equal Opportunities

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, colour, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.
how_to_apply: For more information and to apply, visit https://www.microsoft.com/en-ie/futurenavigators

title: Solution Architect
description:
The Solution Architect is responsible for the design of complex end to end solutions for both new and existing clients. The Solutions Architect is the technical subject matter expert in all technology offering across the professional and managed services catalog. The Solution Architect works closely with the sales team and the customer success team through through the entire process from discovery through implementation. You will work with our data scientists and customers to map out technical requirements and architect a robust and familiar solution made up of components that we support.

By working with our strategic customers, you will identify opportunities for new products and features that enhances what we do, and will work with our product managers and tech leads to continuously improve Cognite's SaaS offering.

The result is a mix of consulting, architecture and product development in a welcoming cross-functional team. Above all else, we strive to foster a supportive team environment where everyone is excited to share ideas, ask for help, and learn from each other.

Cognite is a global industrial Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) company enabling the full-scale digital transformation of heavy-asset industries. Our core software product, Cognite Data Fusion (CDF), powers companies with contextualized OT/IT data to develop and scale solutions that increase safety, sustainability, efficiency, and drive revenue.

Headquartered in Oslo, Norway with offices in Japan and America, Cognite has garnered the attention and partnership of some of the world's top industrial and tech companies, and the company’s success has been profiled in publications like Boston Consulting Group, Bloomberg, Digital Energy Journal, and Forbes. Google awarded Cognite Google Cloud Technology Partner of the Year 2019 for Manufacturing and Austin Business Journal named Cognite 2020 Best Places to Work.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Full Stack
description:
We are a remote-first, office-optional team. You are invited to do the best work of your life from anywhere within the USA.

At Animoto, we have always believed video is the most powerful form of communication. The pandemic has made this more true than ever. Small businesses face unprecedented challenges in connecting with their audiences, as consumers are also challenged to connect with friends and family. Video can bring us together.

That’s why our mission is to help anyone make a powerful, professional video. We make best-in-class, easy-to-use web and mobile video creation apps, with pre-built narrative templates and stunning video styles, that help our customers customize their own engaging videos to share on social media and beyond.

Over the next three years, we have a mission to make video creation faster, easier, and more fun, on any device, in ways that have never been done before.

We are looking for a senior full stack engineer to join our product application teams. You will be working closely with the product, design mobile and other full-stack engineers to help propel our award-winning video creation service to the next level. You will be developing a responsive, elegant web experience and pioneering the next generation of video creation software.

What you’ll do:

  • Collaborate with a team of engineers and product designers to develop new features while iterating and improving the existing experience
  • Build efficient and reusable React components and services using NodeJS and Ruby on Rails
  • Ensure high standards in architecture discussions, code reviews, and provide technical leadership
  • Advocate for best practices, great usability, and exceptional quality

What we’re looking for:

  • 5+ years of professional experience building front-end web applications
  • Expert knowledge of JavaScript
  • Experience with modern JavaScript libraries and tooling
  • Experience with server-side web frameworks
  • Client-side performance and optimization experience
  • Strong Computer Science fundamentals
  • Excellent communication and organization skills

What we offer:

  • Opportunities for professional growth
  • 100% covered health insurance
  • Equity
  • Contribution to 401k
  • $600 as part of our subscriptions perk
  • Remote work setup
  • Bi-weekly Product Demos, Social Thursdays, Focus Fridays
  • Bi-annual company events and hackathons

Please note that we are not currently sponsoring visas.

We embrace the differences of our team members and seek diversity of beliefs, backgrounds, education, and all the other things that make us unique. It is our inherent belief that diverse teams build better products. We aim to create a space where employees can bring their true selves to work every day. Animoto is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We welcome you to be a part of it.

title: React Developer and Consultant
description:
ABOUT BITOVI:

At Bitovi, we design and build the breakthrough web apps today’s businesses need to lead their industries tomorrow. Companies small and large—including some of the world’s most iconic brands—rely on our expertise to deliver outsized results.

An efficient team, we hire only deeply experienced professionals with the talent and passion to push our client projects towards success. We’ve built many of the open-source tools other developers use every day. And our product delivery team can bring even the most complex solutions to fruition.

Known for being easy to work with, we are flexible, friendly and fast. When you need exceptional digital tools that really move the needle, Bitovi delivers web experiences that inspire customer excitement and loyalty.

Our team consists of about 40 developers and designers located around the US and Canada. This is a remote, full-time position. Due to historical travel requirements, we are seeking candidates in the US or Canada who are willing and able to travel in the future once business travel resumes. Travel averages approximately 3-5 days every 10 weeks.

TL;DR A good short read for interested candidates is our blog post Hello Potential Bitovian.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We are looking for highly qualified individuals with the following (in order of priority):

  • 4+ years professional experience developing single page applications
  • A solid background in Modern Front End Development, including JavaScript frameworks
  • Professional experience in React
  • Experience with state management patterns, functional components with hooks, and functional testing
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills who are comfortable interacting with clients
  • A good understanding of Computer Science (CS degree, or equivalent knowledge is required)

We are looking for a candidate who has strong React knowledge and production experience on top of a solid JavaScript background. The interview process will focus on both JavaScript and React understanding. While this role will typically work on React projects with our clients, team members will have the opportunity to work on other frameworks as well.

We welcome diversity and non-traditional paths into the developer profession, and advocate strongly for hiring the right person as opposed to the right combination of tech keywords.

MORE ABOUT THE JOB:

You’ll work with clients to create applications, discussing and designing architectures, reviewing code, and researching new front-end technologies. You’ll have the opportunity to shape a small and growing company by applying your talent and passion to the Angular and JavaScript communities in your own way.

Bitovians often:

  • Present at conferences
  • Give trainings
  • Plan and run meetups
  • Create and maintain open source projects
  • Write articles and create content

BENEFITS:

At Bitovi, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a team of talented individuals who will support and challenge you. You’ll grow through various experiences on client projects as well as internal initiatives and strategic projects.

Bitovians get a slate of great benefits. Bitovi offers:

Competitive salary and yearly bonuses Bi-annual company retreats to places like Las Vegas, New Orleans, and Amelia Island, Florida 401(k) plan with matching 4 weeks of paid vacation Health and dental insurance LTD and Life Insurance Gym membership reimbursement Paid Maternity & Paternity leave Working from home with flexible hours

HOW TO APPLY:

Share a resume and a thoughtful, personalized introduction (don't skip this!) that shows us that you’re the kind of person we’ve described above. Your thoughtful introduction should cover why you are interested in this role, something you recently worked on and are proud of, and a fun fact about yourself.

*Please note that we are not interested in working with Recruiters or Hiring firms at this time. All offers are contingent on passing a successful background check.
